page.title: 04THE MAY CELEBRATION.
page.content: Each year we gather on the Village Green for the May Fair.The crier welcomes everyone and we do the ribbon dance.Then we all parade to the pub where a stick dance is performed.The sticks have bells and ribbons on them.The recorders play "The Cuckoo Song"and we then gather round the Maypole.The story of May Day is told and we dance traditional Maypole dances like barbers pole,spiders web and the plait. The Maypole ribbons are red,blue ,green and yellow to match our costumes which we dyed and made. Our May Queen is crowned,on the decorated hay cart,escorted by Jack'O'the Green.Then we finish with everyone dancing circassian circle followed by the adults dancing the plait,they usually get it wrong but we all have a great time!
